titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert Ewing Anthony, Jr. notebook MC.75
titlestmt.author: Norma Chaires

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-03 11:53:05 -0400.

change.item: Edited by Jasmine Larkin for compliance with DACS and ACM Required Elements for Archival Description.

did.abstract: Robert Ewing Anthony, Jr. graduated from the University of the City of New-York (later New York University) in 1883. The collection comprises his student notebook, dated January 1883.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The provenance of this collection is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 87.008.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection consists of one notebook which is listed in the finding aid. No further arrangment was necessary.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Robert Ewing Anthony, Jr. attended the University of the City of New-York from 1879 to 1883. He was enrolled in the Department of Arts and Science. From 1879 to 1883, the Catalogue of the University of the City of New-York listed his home in Brooklyn. Anthony graduated from the University of the City of New-York in 1883.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Robert Ewing Anthony, Jr. notebook; MC 75; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processing decisions made prior to November 2018 have not been recorded.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the student notebook of Robert Ewing Anthony, Jr. The notebook is titled: "Notes Volume II: Statics Dynamics Hydraulics." According to Anthony, the notes are based on notes of Professor Gillespie of Union College, rearranged and corrected by Professor Charles B. Brush, professor of Civil Engineering at New York University. Additionally, Brush added extracts from "Merrill's Iron Truss bridges" and other data obtained from the investigation, experience, and practice of Spielman and Brush, Civil Engineers. The notebook is dated January 1883.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection, which were created in 1883, are in the public domain. Permission to publish or reproduce is not required.
